Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2010 04:09PM gena wrote: The statistics would get me down too.  I quit looking at them and now do everything I can to help my body. (Faith, chemo, nutrition).  There is always those who survive the odds. Why can't you be one, too? The statistics out there not do not always reflect the trials and treatments that are going on now.  Stage IV breast cancer survivors are living much longer than women 20 years ago.  My prayers are with you. Gena
Posts.Title: Serious denial... texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2010 06:44PM gena wrote: I agree with pee.  Don't let chemo decide when you should get married.  Start living now.  You need to make the decisions about your life, not chemo.
Posts.Title: Wanting to live-and getting married!!! daisylego hrf

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2010 03:43PM gena wrote: I started Abraxane/Avastin and Zometa in April 2009.  Started out every week for 2 months.  Scan showed no mets in neck, no mets in bones, and the 5 mets in liver reduced by half.  Went to every 2 weeks until January 2010.  Mets in liver still shrinking so went to every 3 weeks.  Last scan showed 1 met in liver at 8mm and am still on the every 3 weeks.  My hair started growing in last August and was progressing nicely until he put me on every 3 weeks, because he upped my dosage.  Hair is now thinning more than I would like but a new short hair cut has made a big difference.
Posts.Title: Anyone on Abraxane/Avastin jneumann anamary1

Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2010 06:09PM gena wrote: Abraxane and avastin worked for me.  Had 5 mets in liver, now one and disappearing. Onc really thinks the avastin has been the key.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets...any effective treatment? njboo11 njboo11

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2010 02:51PM gena wrote: First time I went bald I bought a wig.  Thought it was too long so had it trimmed.  The stylist made the bangs look more like my own.  No one knew I had a wig except those I told.  I work at a high school and non of the students knew. They didn't even know I was on chemo. Even when I took it off when my hair came back they just thought I got a short hair cut.  My hair has now thinned out too  much so bought a new wig with a shorter cut.  The stylist again trimmed it to contour to my face.  I went back to work after the summer and no one, not even the ones who knew I had a wig before, knows I have a wig on.  They just think I got highlights.  I will tell them if they ask.
Posts.Title: Left Wig at Home! Lynn1 gena
